main event: The observer saw a bright, metallic, disc-shaped object moving at a high speed and altitude over Manhattan, New York on October 8, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared to move in a straight line, then change direction, indicating it was not a reflection.
The object was brighter than the surrounding stars and had a peaked or rounded dome shape.
The object was estimated to be traveling at around 1,200 mph and was approximately 9 miles away from the observer.
The observer reported the sighting to the local police.
No photographs were included in the report, but the observer provided a sketch of the object and its motion.
sighted object: a metallic, disc-shaped object with a peaked or rounded dome
